creator: Alexander Terp
title: RAD-156: shell confirm: don't fail if not critical command
description:
confirm $!`ls`

if that confirm is rejected, then the script exits.

We should allow like this:

confirm unsafe $`ls`

To then not _exit_ when rejected.

If no `unsafe`, then do usual `fail`/ `recover` blocks.

Basically, `confirm` should simply mean: confirm with user prior to running command. If yes, proceed as normal. If not, simulate command failure with code 1 and exit message User rejected shell command.
